# Water System Annual Reporting Requirements (2026)

## Drinking Water Systems

### Consumer Confidence Report (CCR)

**Who:** Community water systems
**When:** Annually, by July 1
**What:** Report to customers on:
- Water source information
- Detected contaminants
- Compliance status
- Health information

**Delivery:** Mail or electronic with customer notification

### Electronic Annual Report (EAR)

**Who:** All public water systems
**When:** Annually
**Submit to:** DDW through SDWIS
**Contents:**
- System inventory
- Monitoring results
- Treatment information
- Source information

### Surface Water Treatment Reports

**Who:** Systems using surface water
**When:** Monthly and annual
**Contents:**
- Turbidity monitoring
- Disinfection data
- Filter performance

## NPDES Permit Reporting

### Self-Monitoring Reports (SMRs)

**Frequency:** Monthly, quarterly, or annually (per permit)
**Submit to:** Regional Water Board
**Method:** [CIWQS online system](https://ciwqs.waterboards.ca.gov)
**Contents:**
- Discharge monitoring data
- Permit compliance status
- Violation reporting

### Annual Reports

**When:** Per permit schedule
**Contents:**
- Summary of year's monitoring
- Exceedances and explanations
- Corrective actions taken

## Stormwater Permits

### Industrial Permit (IGP)

**Annual Report Due:** July 1
**Submit:** [SMARTS online system](https://smarts.waterboards.ca.gov)
**Contents:**
- Monitoring data
- BMP implementation
- Visual observations
- Exceedance response

### Construction Permit (CGP)

**Reports:** Per permit requirements
**Annual Certification:** Required
**Submit:** [SMARTS online](https://smarts.waterboards.ca.gov)

### Municipal Stormwater (MS4)

**Annual Report:** Per permit schedule
**Contents:**
- Program implementation
- TMDL compliance
- Monitoring results
- Public education activities

## SGMA Reporting

### GSA Annual Reports

**Who:** Groundwater Sustainability Agencies
**When:** April 1 annually
**Submit to:** DWR
**Contents:**
- Groundwater conditions
- Extraction volumes
- Surface water supply
- Change in storage
- Progress toward sustainability

### Five-Year Assessment

**When:** Every 5 years
**Contents:**
- GSP implementation progress
- Sustainability indicator status
- Plan modifications needed

## Key Reporting Systems

### CIWQS
- California Integrated Water Quality System
- NPDES reporting
- [CIWQS Portal](https://ciwqs.waterboards.ca.gov)

### SMARTS
- Stormwater Multiple Application and Report Tracking System
- Stormwater permits
- [SMARTS Portal](https://smarts.waterboards.ca.gov)

### SDWIS
- Safe Drinking Water Information System
- Drinking water reporting
- Contact DDW for access

### GeoTracker
- Cleanup site reporting
- Tank releases
- [GeoTracker Portal](https://geotracker.waterboards.ca.gov)

## Consequences of Non-Reporting

- Compliance violations
- Enforcement actions
- Potential penalties
- Public disclosure

**Tip:** Set calendar reminders well before due dates! See the [SWRCB website](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov) for the latest reporting deadlines and system updates.

## Take Action

1. **Set up your reporting accounts** — register for [CIWQS](https://ciwqs.waterboards.ca.gov) for NPDES permits, [SMARTS](https://smarts.waterboards.ca.gov) for stormwater permits, and [GeoTracker](https://geotracker.waterboards.ca.gov) for cleanup site reporting.
2. **Create a reporting calendar** with all due dates — CCRs by July 1, monthly/quarterly SMRs per your permit, IGP annual reports by July 1, and GSA annual reports by April 1.
3. **Check the [SWRCB website](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov)** for updated reporting forms, system maintenance schedules, and deadline changes.
4. **File reports on time** — late reporting is itself a compliance violation that can trigger enforcement actions, penalties, and public disclosure.
